thread.title: Amy Robach to speak at breast cancer awareness event in Somerset
thread.title_full: Amy Robach to speak at breast cancer awareness event in Somerset

title: Amy Robach to speak at breast cancer awareness event in Somerset
text:
Amy Robach to speak at breast cancer awareness event in Somerset October 12, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 12, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
HEALTH: TV show co-host to speak at breast cancer event 
Amy Robach, co-host of ABC’s "Good Morning America" and a breast cancer survivor, will be among the guest speakers Wednesday at Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital’s Breast Cancer Awareness Month event. The television personality was diagnosed two years ago after agreeing to undergo a mammogram on "GMA." She later underwent a double mastectomy. Dr. Deb Toppmeyer, chief medical officer of Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey, and Dr. Kathleen Toomey, medical director of the Steeplechase Cancer Center at RWJUH Somerset, will address risk factors, signs and symptoms, prevention and treatment. Tickets are $20, which includes a gift bag, a buffet dinner and a copy of Robach’s new book, "Better: How I Let Go of Control, Held on to Hope and Found Joy in My Darkest Hour." The event is 5:45 to 9 p.m., The Imperia, 1714 Easton Ave., Somerset. To register, call 888-637-9584 or visit rwjuh.edu/events. 
— Christina Joseph
